Dear Ziad,                    Thanks for the quick response to my initial email.                    My deadline is tight, but I think I can manage a 2-3 day turnaround for this shipment of polymer. I have a crew with five MT, which they can load by crane. Could you advise when you can perform your bulk product discharge? I can also advise a supplier in Aqaba.                    I look forward to hearing from you.                    Regards,                    Marvin
Email 2:
Dear Ziad,                      Thanks for the email. I will forward this information to my fellow countrymen who will help me bring down the purchase cost by $5/MT. I would appreciate it if you can provide a detailed cost analysis of the delivered cost, this will help in my internal discussions. I have attached an image of the facility layout. Please have a look and let me know if you require any further information. I will be in touch.                      Regards,                      Harvey

Email 2:
Hello Penny,
    It depends on the vessel being used and the type of material being loaded.
    When you move 12500mt in a single shipment, there are some factors that affect this amount as well:
    1) Max. Weight of each vessel, which depends on the type of vessel (tanker, lighthouse, etc.)
    2) The “type” of material that you are transporting and their density.
    3) The amount of space you are occupying in each “stack” (which can range from one to five depending on the type of vessel and its design)
    So, basically, you should consider that for every ton of material you move you can load a specific amount of empty spaces available (which is determined by the vessel’s design and type) in order to have a full “load” but it’s not a guarantee that you will fill all

    In the transportation of Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) as a bulk commodity, there are 3 different types of tankers that are used:
    A) The “Single Deck” tankers (which are also known as “LNG vessels”); B) The “Double Deck” tankers (known as “LPG Carriers”); and C) The “Truck Tanker” (a semi-trailer that can be driven on the highway or even be used as a “road-train” in some cases). 
    There are some factors that need to be taken into consideration for each of them:

It is the purpose of emails to coordinate, communicate, and conduct business. This section examines a sample of email threads between buyers and sellers. In many ways, email resembles face-to-face conversations, which were analyzed in the last section.

Emails are more asynchronous than face-to-face conversations. While email conversations allow for a lot of discussion, they are also prone to misunderstandings, miscommunication, and misinterpretation. Email users can only respond to a message when they receive it, but in the process of email composition, it takes a lot of time before a response is sent. Communication between two email users is often delayed and incomplete. Also, email messages are prone to re-read
